intro: Pozopsis cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf pozopsis, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves, which are typically glossy and have a smooth texture. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
